snippet: The position of adjunct faculty member, though increasingly common, offers no job security, no health benefits and no assured pathway to full-time university employment.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column profiles James D Hoff, adjunct lecturer who, nearly 18 months after being awarded a PhD in English, cobbles together a living by lining up courses to teach at different colleges around New York City; Hoff is among growing body of adjunct professors who are offered no job security or health benefits and are struggling to find full-time university employment.
lead_paragraph: The position of adjunct faculty member, though increasingly common, offers no job security, no health benefits and no assured pathway to full-time university employment.

headline.main: Crowded Out of Ivory Tower, Adjuncts See a Life Less Lofty
headline.print_headline: Crowded Out of Ivory Tower, Adjuncts See a Life Less Lofty
